text: ID: 235	TITLE: A Sailor-Made Man	GENRE: Comedy	PLOT: When The Girl's father insists that, before he will agree to The Boy's marrying his daughter, he must first prove that he can do something more worthwhile than act the playboy. He joins the navy. When his ship docks at a Middle Eastern kingdom, The Girl and her father also arrive by yacht. The local maharajah kidnaps The Girl and it is up to The Boy to rescue her.

ID: 469	TITLE: The Karnival Kid	GENRE: Animation, Short, Comedy	PLOT: ______ is selling hot dogs at a carnival next to the tent for ________________________. He gets into an argument with the barker. ______ beckons him over to her trailer; he shows off the tricks his pups have been trained to do, and she picks one. It climbs onto the bun but runs away when she bites in. Later that evening, ______ plays guitar and two cats sing outside Minnie's window; they eventually awaken someone, who throws things at them until they stop.

ID: 564	TITLE: The Criminal Code	GENRE: Crime, Drama, Romance	PLOT: A wily D.A.(Brady) gets a 10 year conviction of a young 20 year old (Robert Graham)who he knows killed a man in self defense. Years later _____ becomes warden of the prison holding ______. When _____ realizes that 6 years of working in the prison jute mill has pushed ______ to the breaking point, he gives him a chance- a new job as his valet. ______ responds well and earns the respect of both the warden and his beautiful daughter. Graham's mettle is put to the test when he stumbles onto a prison murder committed by his cell-mate. He must choose between the criminal code of silence and the warden's strong persuasion to reveal the killer.

ID: 417	TITLE: The Last Command	GENRE: Drama, History, Romance, War	PLOT: A decorated, aristocratic _______________ is reduced to penury after the collapse of Imperial ______. An old adversary, now a successful ________ hires the general to re-enact the revolution which deposed him.

ID: 254	TITLE: Nosferatu	GENRE: Fantasy, Horror	PLOT: ________, _______ based estate agent Knock dispatches his associate, ______, to Count Orlok's castle in Transylvania as the Count wants to purchase an isolated house in ________. They plan on selling him the one across the way from Hutter's own home. ______ leaves his innocent wife, _____, with some friends while he is away. Hutter's trek is an unusual one, with many locals not wanting to take him near the castle where strange events have been occurring. Once at the castle, ______ does manage to sell the Count the house, but he also notices and feels unusual occurrences, primarily feeling like there is a dark shadow hanging over him, even in the daytime when the Count is unusually asleep. ______ eventually sees the Count's sleeping chamber in a crypt, and based on a book he has recently read, believes the Count is really a vampire or _________. While ______ is trapped in the castle, the Count, hiding in a shipment of coffins, makes his way to ________, causing death along his way, which most attribute to the plague. ______ himself tries to rush home to save his town and most importantly save _____ from Nosferatu's imminent arrival. In ________, _____ can feel the impending darkness as _________ gets closer. But she learns that a sinless woman can sacrifice herself to kill the vampire. Will ______ be able to save _____ either from _________ and/or her self-sacrifice?

ID: 140	TITLE: His Wedding Night	GENRE: Short, Comedy	PLOT: In a drugstore Al and ______ are rivals for Alice. ______ slings melons and operates the gas pump. ______ delivers a wedding gown for Alice, begins modeling it, is mistaken for _____ and is kidnapped by Al.

ID: 579	TITLE: Indiscreet	GENRE: Comedy, Romance	PLOT: ___________ is a ______ based actress. She has been unable to find love in her life. The reason why she came home early from a vacation to _______ fits into that theme, as the man she met there and was initially attracted to ended up not being who she thought he was as a man. Upon her arrival home, she meets the suave ____________, a financier who is a work acquaintance of her brother-in-law, ________ _____________. ______ initially states that there is no Mrs. _____ in his life. But when ____ later asks him out, he clarifies that statement in that there is no Mrs. _____ in ______, as she is at home in _____________. Regardless, ____ decides still to ask him on the date she had intended to the ballet. He accepts, letting her know that whatever happens between the two of them that he will never be able to leave his wife. As time goes on, the two fall in love, their happiness which can only be sustained as long as ______ has his Paris-based contract with NATO. So when ______ announces that he is being transferred to ________ for five months, ____ comes to the realization that she truly cannot live without him and wants to marry him. Shortly thereafter, ____ learns something about Philip's background, which not only threatens their relationship, but leads to a night that ____ wants to give him that he will never forget, and not in a good way. But the best laid plans may have a bumpy road to being executed effectively...

ID: 9	TITLE: The Music Lover	GENRE: Short, Comedy, Music	PLOT: A marching band appears, and the band-leader prepares to give them the music for the song he wants them to play. He has prepared a large staff above their heads, and he now creates notes by making duplicates of his own head, placing them on the staff, and completing the notes with sticks and other implements taken from the band members. When he has finished, the players attempt to perform the music that has been written in such an unusual fashion.

ID: 549	TITLE: Bad Girl	GENRE: Drama, Romance	PLOT: A mug and a jane: _______ knows that every guy is going to make a pass at her; _____ knows that every gal wastes her money on good times. He's saving to open a repair shop. When the two of them meet, they can't believe they get along. One evening he leaves her waiting in the rain; she finds his apartment and reads him the riot act. They end up spooning and napping until 4 AM. She's afraid of her brother, who's her guardian, so _____ figures she should tell her brother that she's getting married the next morning. _______ tries out the story but knows _____ won't show up. It's the first of a series of promises, fears, miscalculations, and hard knocks. Where will they end up?

ID: 511	TITLE: Escape from Dartmoor	GENRE: Crime, Drama	PLOT: Flashback story of an escape from the lonely, high-security Dartmoor Prison. A jealous __________________ is enraged by the attentions that his manicurist girlfriend pays to a customer. He threatens the customer with an open razor and lands in gaol.

ID: 84	TITLE: The Rounders	GENRE: Comedy, Western	PLOT: ___ and _____ are a couple of aging cowboys who bust broncos out of ______ for ___ Ed Love, a slick ________ if ever there was one. Sisters, ___ and ______, have their eyes on ___ and _____, but the boys aren't ready to settle down yet. They spend the winter in the high country corralling more than 100 stray cattle at $7 a head for ______. Most years, they blow their winter pay in one spring night at a ______ bar, but this year, ___ and _____ have a plan: to take an ornery roan that ___ has been unable to break and bet their bankroll that no cowboy at the ______ rodeo can stay on the horse. What will they do if they win - marry the sisters or head for Tahiti?

ID: 48	TITLE: Caught in a Cabaret	GENRE: Short, Comedy	PLOT: Given an hour off from his job as a cafe ______, _______ rescues _____ from a thug, is given an invitation to her home, and arrives presenting a card which falsely identifies him as the Greek Ambassador. Before he can get back to work, her parents invite him to a future garden party. Her jealous lover has _______ followed back to the cafe. _______ is a hit at the garden party but, as he leaves to return to work, the rival invites everyone to go with him to the cafe so Charlie will be exposed.

ID: 256	TITLE: Pay Day	GENRE: Comedy, Short	PLOT: _______ is an expert bricklayer. He has lots of fun and work and enjoys himself greatly while at the saloon. As he leaves work his wife takes the pay he has hidden in his hat. But he steals her purse so he can go out for the evening. He has a terrible time getting home on a very rainy night. When he does so he finds his wife waiting for him with a rolling pin.

ID: 284	TITLE: Hot Water	GENRE: Comedy	PLOT: Episodic look at married life and in-law problems. Adventures include a ride on a crowded trolley with a live turkey; a wild spin in a new auto with the in-laws in tow; and a sequence in which _____ accidently chloroforms his mother-in-law and is convinced that he has killed her. When she begins sleep-walking, he thinks that she has returned to haunt him.

ID: 184	TITLE: Male and Female	GENRE: Adventure, Drama	PLOT: Lord Brockelhurst, his unwilling betrothed Lady ____, his butler ________ and scullery maid ______ are on Lord Loam's yacht which is wrecked leaving them all to cope on a desert island. Class distinctions fall apart for the time being.

ID: 185	TITLE: The Doll	GENRE: Comedy, Fantasy	PLOT: Because the ____________________ wants to preserve his family line, he forces his timid nephew ________ to choose one of the village maidens to wed. ________ flees to a monastery to escape the forty eager maidens. When the gluttonous monks discover that the _____ is offering a large sum for the marriage, they suggest ________ marry a mechanical doll instead. The doll maker has just finished making a replica of his daughter ____, but his _________ accidentally breaks it and convinces the real girl to mimic the doll. ________ buys her, thinking she is a doll, and takes her back to the monastery, where they are wed.

ID: 136	TITLE: The Butcher Boy	GENRE: Comedy, Drama	PLOT: _______ and ___ live the usual playful, fantasy filled childhoods of normal boys. However, with a violent, alcoholic father and a manic depressive, suicidal mother the pressure on _______ to grow up are immense. Unfortunately, one tragedy after another, _______'s world sinks deeper and deeper into paranoia (directed mainly against Mrs. ______, a nasty neighbor) and fantasy (where he has visions of the Virgin ____).

ID: 603	TITLE: Platinum Blonde	GENRE: Comedy, Romance	PLOT: Reporter Gallagher loves ________ _____ who marries Anne. He's soon bored being married to a socialite and asks _________ to help him write a play. She arrives with a bunch of _________ and the mansion turns into a party. ____ arrives and orders them out and _____ goes with them.

ID: 233	TITLE: The Two Orphans	GENRE: Comedy	PLOT: ______ nineteenth century : Two middle aged orphans _______ and ________ find out (thanks to a soothsayer) that one is the offspring of the Hangman of _____ and the other is the son of a count. But it is only a dream of theirs...

ID: 483	TITLE: Queen Kelly	GENRE: Drama	PLOT: Prince _______ is the betrothed of mad Queen ______ V of ________. Supreme ruler, her word is law and he is a playboy. On maneuvers as punishment for partying with other women, he sees _____ walking the the other students of a convent. He is intrigued by her beauty and wants her. He kidnaps her that night from the convent and takes her to his room and professes his love for her. When the Queen finds them together the next morning , she whips _____ and throws her out of the castle. ______ then puts _______ into prison for not wanting to marry the Queen. _____ goes to German East ______ to visit her dying ____ and is forced to marry the disgusting Jan. The Aunt dies after the wedding and _____ refuses to live with ___ and becomes the head of _______________. Her extravagances and style earn her the name 'Queen Kelly' and Prince _______ does not marry Queen Regina V.

ID: 379	TITLE: The Love of Sunya	GENRE: Drama	PLOT: In ancient _____, an evil priest drove a pure maiden to suicide. In today's reincarnation, to free himself the priest must find and help the maiden...now a young American singing student, _____________, who is torn between pursuing a career in European opera, going to _____________ with fiancée ____, or saving her father from financial ruin by marrying wealthy Robert Goring. The ancient priest, reincarnated as a gypsy vagabond, grants her visions of her future life if she should follow each of the three roads. Does each have a fatal drawback?

ID: 455	TITLE: The Cocoanuts	GENRE: Comedy, Musical	PLOT: Mr. ______ runs a bankrupt _______ hotel. He'll try anything to make money, even make love to rich Mrs. ______. But his main scheme, selling real estate, is in danger of sabotage from zanies _____ and _____, who also reduce the schemes of a pair of jewel thieves to chaos. A subplot involves the star-crossed love of ____________ and _________ _________.

ID: 477	TITLE: The Mysterious Island	GENRE: Adventure, Romance, Sci-Fi	PLOT: On a volcanic island near the kingdom of ______ rules Count ______, a benevolent leader and _________ who has eliminated class distinction among the island's inhabitants. Dakkar, his daughter _____ and her fiance, ________ _____________ have designed a submarine which _____ pilots on its initial voyage just before the island is overrun by ___________, despotic ruler of ______. _____ sets out after Roget in a second submarine and the two craft, diving to the ocean's floor, discover a strange land populated by dragons, giant squid and an eerie undiscovered humanoid race.

ID: 583	TITLE: Laughing Sinners	GENRE: Drama, Romance	PLOT: Cafe entertainer ___________ falls for sleazy salesman _____________ and jumps from a bridge when he dumps her. Saved by Salvation Army officer ____, ___ reforms and joins the Army. When she runs into ______ she falls for him all over again. ____ beats up ______ and gives a speech to Ivy which induces her to return to the Army and to ____.

ID: 422	TITLE: Lonesome	GENRE: Comedy, Drama, Romance	PLOT: A lonesome boy and a lonesome girl meet accidentally on their Saturday-off at ____________. It is love at fight sight but over the bewilderment of their sudden romance and escape from loneliness, they don't even realize they don'y even known each other's name until a fire breaks out and they are separated.

ID: 139	TITLE: Easy Street	GENRE: Short, Comedy	PLOT: When _________________ wanders into a mission he is smitten by ____ and puts back the collection box which he has taken. Reformed, he becomes a _________ and is assigned to rough-and-tumble Easy Street. Unable to trick or beat ____ the Tough, he puts ____'s head in a gas pipe and anesthetizes him. A hero, he now helps many poor people living on Easy Street. ____ escapes jail, ____ is kidnapped, but _______ (recharged after sitting on a doper's needle) conquers all. Easy Street is transformed as is ____.

ID: 55	TITLE: The Fatal Mallet	GENRE: Short, Comedy	PLOT: _______ throws a brick at a man and woman and gets it thrown back at him. The rivals fight. The lady leaves with a third suitor. _______ finds a wooden mallet with which he subdues both rivals, locking them in a barn. He kicks the lady who instantly falls for him.

ID: 465	TITLE: The Hollywood Revue of 1929	GENRE: Musical	PLOT: ____________, representing the Hollywood movie community, and __________, representing the ________ stage community, act as the interlocutors of a musical comedy revue. A plethora of chorus boys and girls are featured front and center in some of the song and dance numbers, and provide back-up to some other acts. But the revue primarily is a vehicle to highlight a cavalcade of _________ movie and ________ stage stars. One early running gag has both _____ and _____ playing straight man to _____________, who just wants a nice introduction to his act. _______ would return later to be featured along with the Brox Sisters in one of the highlights of the second act, a production number around the song "Singin' in ____", complete with rain soaked stage. A reprise of the song with the entire cast acts as the revue's finale.

ID: 460	TITLE: Woman in the Moon	GENRE: Comedy, Drama, Romance, Sci-Fi	PLOT: Thirty years ago, at a scientific conference, Prof. Manfeldt presented his theory on the existence of gold on the Moon. It was greeted with laughter by the assembled academics. Today, ___________ has ambitious plans to build a spaceship... and take it to the Moon! Windegger, his chief engineer, will be going, and so will Prof. ________, now living in a cramped garret alone with his theory. But there are disagreements with the financiers who insist that their man ______ also accompany the flight... The unmanned Rocket H 32 brings back valuable information from the dark side of the Moon. ______ is upset by the news of Windegger's engagement to the pretty Friede. And the financiers have a secret agenda: to control the world's gold supply... Finally, the Spaceship "______" is ready as it rolls out on its gantry for takeoff. The staged rocket works as planned, but the acceleration is fierce. As they approach the Moon, they discover a stowaway on board, ______, a little boy...

ID: 61	TITLE: His Favorite Pastime	GENRE: Short, Comedy	PLOT: _______ gets into a fight at his regular bar and finally crawls out under the door. He then boards a streetcar and follows a beautiful lady in a taxi. He breaks into her home. Her husband comes finds him trying to seduce his wife.

ID: 354	TITLE: The Temptress	GENRE: Drama, Romance	PLOT: In a masked ball in _____, ______________, a young Argentinian architect, meets _____, the Marquess of ____________. Later, the young woman is rightly accused causing the misfortune and loss of wealth of ________, a man who fell for her charms. To escape social criticism, the Marquis of ____________ transfers his residence to _________. There, _____ meets again ______, when he is building a river's dam. ___________, a thug, harasses _____, and when ______ intervenes, he defies him to a whip duel. The duel is long and vicious, both men suffering many cuts on their faces and naked chests, but in the end, the thug is vanquished and humiliated. ___________ sets up an ambush to murder ______, but the Marquis of ____________ is killed instead. Now, there only two men in love for _____, the eternal temptress^Å

ID: 428	TITLE: The Racket	GENRE: Crime, Drama, Film-Noir, Thriller	PLOT: The big national crime _________ has moved into town, partnering up with local crime ____ ____________. There are only two problems: First, ____ is the violent type, preferring to do things the old-fashioned way instead of using the syndicate's more genteel methods. The second problem is McQuigg, the only honest police captain on the force, and his loyal patrolman, _______. Together, they take on the violent ____ and try to foil the syndicate's plans to elect _____, the crooked __________ running for a crooked judgeship.

ID: 82	TITLE: Recreation	GENRE: Comedy, Short	PLOT: _______ is walking in the park. A girl leaves a seaman on one bench and joins _______ on another. The seaman wakes up. He and _______ stage a brick fight. Policemen get hit and arrest both men. During an ensuing fight on the dock the _________, the seaman, _______ and the girl wind up in the water.

ID: 433	TITLE: Spies	GENRE: Romance, Thriller	PLOT: Haghi is a criminal mastermind whose ubiquitous spy operation is always several steps ahead of the police and the government's secret service. Enter Agent 326, the daring and dashing young man, who thinks his disguise as a dirty, bearded vagrant is fooling the unknown mastermind and his minions. But _____ is well aware of 326's existence and what he looks like. ___________, a Russian lady in Haghi's employ. _____ wants _____ to subvert the efforts of the government agent, but doesn't count on her falling in love with him. Meanwhile, _____ is anxious to get his hands on a Japanese peace treaty in the possession of the cunning _______________, whose mistress is also in his employ.

ID: 183	TITLE: The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari	GENRE: Fantasy, Horror, Mystery, Thriller	PLOT: _______, a young man, recalls in his memory the horrible experiences he and his fiancée ____ recently went through. It is the annual fair in Holstenwall. _______ and his friend ____ visit The Cabinet of Dr. ________, an exhibit where the mysterious doctor shows the somnambulist ______, and awakens him for some moments from his death-like sleep. When ____ asks ______ about his future, ______ answers that he will die before dawn. The next morning ____ is found dead. _______ suspects Cesare of being the murderer, and starts spying on him and Dr. ________. The following night ______ is going to stab ____ in her bed, but softens when he sees the beautiful woman, and instead of committing another murder, he abducts her. Jane's father awakens because of the noise, and he and some servants follow the fleeing ______. When ______ cannot outrun his pursuers anymore, he gently places ____ down on the ground, and runs away. _______ and the ______ investigate the caravan of Dr. ________, but the doctor succeeds in slipping away. _______ pursues the fleeing Dr. ________, and sees him disappear into a madhouse. _______ enters the madhouse, where he is sure he will find the truth behind all these mysterious events.

ID: 319	TITLE: The Monster	GENRE: Drama, Fantasy, Horror	PLOT: _____ is the alcoholic and smoking addicted mother of the young, but mature teenager _____. They live together since Kathy's husband ___ left her, and she neglects her daughter. _____ is supposed to drive _____ to her father's home in the morning, but she sleeps until late afternoon and they have to travel during a rainy night. While driving through a lonely road through the woods, _____ hits a wolf that breaks her car, leaving them stranded on the empty road. They call 911 and while waiting for the tow truck and an ambulance, the wolf disappears from the road. When the tow truck arrives, the mechanic _____ tells that he needs to fix the axle and an oil leakage to tow her car. While repairing the vehicle, a monster attacks him but neither _____ nor _____ note. When they seek _____ out, they realize that they are not alone in the spot. Further, _____ learns that monsters do exist. Will they be rescued on time?

ID: 307	TITLE: The Eagle	GENRE: Action, Adventure, Drama, History, War	PLOT: In 140 AD, twenty years after the unexplained disappearance of the entire Ninth Legion in the mountains of Scotland, young centurion _____________ (Tatum) arrives from ____ to solve the mystery and restore the reputation of his father, the commander of the Ninth. Accompanied only by his British slave ____ (Bell), ______ sets out across Hadrian's Wall into the uncharted highlands of Caledonia - to confront its savage tribes, make peace with his father's memory, and retrieve the lost legion's golden emblem, the Eagle of the Ninth.

ID: 586	TITLE: M	GENRE: Crime, Mystery, Thriller	PLOT: In _______, ____________ is an unknown ______ of girls. He whistles ____________'s 'In The Hall of the Mountain King', from the 'Peer Gynt' Suite I Op. 46 while attracting the little girls for death. The police force pressed by the Minister give its best effort trying unsuccessfully to arrest the _____________. The organized crime has great losses due to the intense search and siege of the police and decides to chase the murderer, with the support of the beggars association. They catch ____ and briefly judge him.

ID: 202	TITLE: Number, Please?	GENRE: Short, Comedy, Romance	PLOT: ______ is spending the day at the amusement park, unfulfilled and alone. He thinks his day has the possibility of looking up when he spots _______, the girl of his dreams, on a date at the park with ___. ______ thinks he can take _______ away from ___. ______ does whatever he can to impress _______, while putting ___ in a bad light. Ultimately, _______, who has two tickets for a romantic hot air balloon ride, says that she will take that ride with whoever can get the approval from her mother to do so first. ______ gets into one misadventure after another in the entire process, which includes being in possession of a stolen purse, which he is unaware belongs to _______ and which contains the two tickets.

ID: 52	TITLE: Dough and Dynamite	GENRE: Comedy, Short	PLOT: _______ and another waiter must become bakers when the regular bakers go out on strike. The strikers put dynamite in a piece of bread which is delivered to the cake counter. It winds up in the oven and explodes.

ID: 194	TITLE: An Eastern Westerner	GENRE: Comedy, Short, Family, Western	PLOT: A young New Yorker is the bane of his Christian parent's existence because of his constant carousing and partying at all hours. As such, his father decides to send the young man to live at ranch of his uncle in Piute Pass in the wild west to get him away from the ________ temptations that lead to this unwanted behavior. Before he even gets to the ranch, the young man gets into one misadventure after another using his New York sensibilities in __________. His primary misadventure involves a sweet young ingénue, the two who fall for each other at first sight. Her father is being held captive by "___________________, who owns half the county and bullies the rest with his band called the Masked Angels. The ransom is her womanly favors to him. The young man tries to help free the father so that the young man and the ingénue can live happily ever after together, which does not sit well with Tiger Lip and the Masked Angels.

ID: 532	TITLE: Our Blushing Brides	GENRE: Drama	PLOT: Three department store girls--______, ______, and _____--share an apartment on West 91st Street in _____________. Each earns little more than 20 dollars per week. _____ is the sensible one, but the others throw themselves at amoral rich men in an attempt to hook one and better themselves. They end up being hurt and disappointed despite _____'s attempts to warn them.

ID: 98	TITLE: The Cheat	GENRE: Drama, Romance	PLOT: ___________ uses charity funds for Wall Street investments in hopes of buying some new gowns. She loses all the money and borrows from wealthy oriental ____. When her husband gives her the amount she borrowed, ____ won't take it back, branding her shoulder with a Japanese sign of his ownership. She shoots him. Her husband takes the blame. In court _____ reveals all to an angry mob.

ID: 62	TITLE: His Musical Career	GENRE: Short, Comedy	PLOT: _______ and his partner are to deliver a piano to 666 Prospect St. and repossess one from 999 Prospect St. They confuse the addresses. The difficulties of delivering the piano by mule cart, and most of the specific gags, appeared later in ______ and Hardy's "The Music Box".

ID: 249	TITLE: Foolish Wives	GENRE: Drama, Thriller	PLOT: "Count" Karanzim, a ________ is with his cousins in ___________, living from faked money and the money he gets from rich ladies, who are attracted by his charmes and his title or his militaristic and aristocratic behaviour. He tries to have success with Mrs Hughes, the wife of the new US ambassador.

ID: 454	TITLE: Bulldog Drummond	GENRE: Drama, Mystery, Thriller	PLOT: Hugh 'Bulldog' ________ is a British WWI veteran who longs for some excitement after he returns to the humdrum existence of civilian life. He gets what he's looking for when a girl requests his help in freeing her uncle from a nursing home. She believes the home is just a front and that her uncle is really being held captive while the culprits try to extort his fortune from him.

ID: 513	TITLE: The Divorcee	GENRE: Romance, Drama	PLOT: _____ and ___ are young, in love, and part of the New York 'in-crowd'. Jerry's decision to marry ___ crushes a yearning ____. Distraught ____ gets drunk and wrecks his car, disfiguring young _______'s face in the process. Out of pity, ____ marries _______. Years later, the apparent perfect marriage of ___ and _____ falls apart from infidelity on both sides. Inwardly unhappy, popular Jerry lives a party life while ___ sinks into a life of alcoholism. _____ then runs into ____, who still loves her. After spending time together with _____, ____ plans to divorce _______. When _____ sees _______ again, she has second thoughts about where her life is heading.

ID: 389	TITLE: Spring Fever	GENRE: Drama	PLOT: Hired to spy on a philandering husband, Luo ______ soon becomes entangled in a clandestine affair with the other man. Along with Luo's girlfriend, they succumb to the delirium of drunken nights, but how long can their tryst last?

ID: 500	TITLE: Another Fine Mess	GENRE: Comedy, Short	PLOT: Homeless, penniless and one step ahead of the police, _______ and ______ take refuge in the home of big-game hunter ________________ while the owner is on safari. When Lord and Lady ________ call to enquire about renting the house, ______ pretends to be ________________, while _______ masquerades as both ______ and maid. All goes as well as can be expected, with Lady ________ and _______, in his guise as "_____," engaging in girl talk, until the real Colonel ________ returns unexpectedly.

ID: 479	TITLE: Our Modern Maidens	GENRE: Drama, Comedy	PLOT: Young vivacious ______ uses her charms on influential ___________ ____________ in hopes of getting her secret fiancée ___ a diplomatic appointment. Meanwhile ___'s affections meander to beautiful ingenue ________, ______'s best friend. After securing ___'s appointment, ______ is crushed to learn of Billie's impending marriage. What ______ didn't count on was ___ getting ________ pregnant. This throws her wedding day into scandal and creates turmoil in the lives of the youthful quartet.

ID: 152	TITLE: The Outlaw and His Wife	GENRE: Drama	PLOT: A stranger comes to work at widow Halla's farm. Halla and the stranger fall in love, but when he is revealed as ______, an escaped thief forced into crime by his family's starvation, they flee and become two of the many outlaws of Iceland's mountains.

ID: 361	TITLE: The Battle of the Century	GENRE: Short, Comedy	PLOT: Fight _______ (Hardy) takes out an insurance policy on his puny pugilist (______) and then proceeds to try to arrange for an accident so that he can collect. When a pie delivery man (Hall) slips on a banana peel, meant for the fighter, a classic pie throwing scene results.

ID: 515	TITLE: Feet First	GENRE: Comedy	PLOT: Ambitious shoe ________, ______, unknowingly meets the ____' daughter and tells her he is a leather tycoon. The rest of the film he spends hiding his true circumstances, in the store and later on a ship. Trying to deliver a letter, he later finds himself dangling high above the street on a building's scaffolding.

ID: 39	TITLE: The Mothering Heart	GENRE: Short, Drama	PLOT: A young couple struggle to get ahead, the wife always assuaging the troubles of her melancholy husband. As he climbs the ladder of success, he abandons the homely values and takes up with another woman. His wife leaves him, returning to her mother's home where she bears a child. When the husband is abandoned by his concubine, remorse drives him to find his wife...

ID: 594	TITLE: Night Nurse	GENRE: Comedy, Crime, Drama	PLOT: _________ manages to land a job in a hospital as a trainee nurse. Upon completion of her training she goes to work as a night nurse for two small children who seem to be very sick, but something much more sinister is going on.

ID: 104	TITLE: A Night in the Show	GENRE: Comedy, Short	PLOT: Mr. ____ tries several theatre seats before winding up in front in a fight with the conductor. He is thrown out. In the lobby he pushes a fat lady into a fountain and returns to sit down by ____. Mr. _____, in the gallery, pours beer down on Mr. ____ and ____. He attacks patrons, a harem ______, the singers Dot and ____, and a fire-eater.

ID: 444	TITLE: A Woman of Affairs	GENRE: Drama	PLOT: Even when _____, _______ and _____ played together as children, _____ knew that she loved ____. But ______, ____' father, did not like any _______. Since ____ did not have any money, ______ sent him off to _____ to work and also talked him out of marrying _____ before he left. _____ waited two years and then married _____, who ______ thought was the greatest thing since sliced bread.
